wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Colonel James Hanna McCormick,  (September 1875 – May 1955)  was a professional soldier and Ulster Unionist Party politician.

Belfast St Anne's (Northern Ireland Parliament constituency)

response: The organisation was established in 1931 by a group inspired in part by the example of the Scottish Protestant League.  It initially had some links with the Ulster Unionist Party (UUP), and UUP members such as James Hanna McCormick attended its meetings.Graham Walker, A History of the Ulster Unionist Party: Protest, Pragmatism And Pessimism
